12.content:
Krypto looked about, unsure of why everything was so... black. The Dog Patrol Ship had seemingly vanished, and so had the rest of the world. In his thoughts, he nearly got hit by a hydrogen atom. "Whoa!" he shouted. ..and then realization struck. "I'm the size of an ATOM!" he screamed, a little bit scared of the world around him. His size, however, increased so that he saw all the nuclei of elemental atoms flitting about. Still growing in size, he eventually became a picometer big. Still incredibly small, but he wasn't atomic anymore.

Now Krypto could see the atoms proper. As he continued to grow, he became big enough to see water. Literally, he could see a molecule of water. His size increased, eventually becoming a nanometer big. He could see the buckyball, the nanotube, and a Glucose molecule, as well as large phospholipids. In short order, as his size grew, he could then see all the things that made humans sick. He grew to a micrometer big, watching the world and all around it. Slowly, he continued to grow to a millimeter's size... and continued to grow, thankfully.

His size finally stopped at his regular size, and to him... it all seemed like a dream at first. But just to be sure, he washed his paws just in case.
12.title: Forget the inch - try the Femtometer!

Kevin was just considering his situation when Krypto flew through the window. At Kevin's new size, he gaped as Krypto loomed before him. The dog was now the size of an office building. His powerful white legs towered above the boy, and his paws landed on the floor with a boom. "Kevin, I'm back!" he called. Casting a brief glance over at his bed, though, Krypto found it empty. "Huh, that's weird." He began looking around. "Kevin?"

"Krypto, over here! Over here Krypto!" Kevin yelled and waved his hand, hoping to catch his dog's attention.

1323.content:
Kevin began to grow nervous as he saw the look on his dog's face. "Uh, Krypto?"

"Well hey there Kevin." The dog lay down to talk to him more closely, his warm breath washing over the boy. His voice was unbearably loud up close, and Kevin had to clap his hands over his ears. "How are you doing?"

He couldn't believe his ears. "I'm tiny! See?!"

"Oh, I know. It worked."

Kevin blinked. "What worked?"

"I had some of the Dog Star guys work on that alien technology, with the shrink ray. Apparently it works, which means I can go on to the next stage of my plan."

"What plan?"

Krypto stood up again, his intimidating figure towering over Kevin as he smirked. "Let's just say I'm starting to see Mechanicat's point of view a bit. I keep trying to save the world, and it never works. So I think I'm going to try a different approach - I can protect the world better, and no one will bother it, if I'm in charge of it..."

"No, no!" Kevin couldn't believe his ears. "Krypto, you can't do that!"

"Sure I can. I just have to make sure that it works, though, and you did that for me. With my shrink ray, I'll shrink the entire planet and everyone on it - except for me. Then I'll juist put myself in charge, and hope that no one objects."

Kevin shook his head. "Do...does the Dog Star team know about this?"
1323.title: Krypto's Evil Scheme
